intro: Rubroshorea parvistipulata, commonly known as the small-tipped redshorea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and vibrant red flowers that bloom during the wet season. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species with medicinal and ornamental value. Its compact size and striking floral display make it a popular choice for ornamental horticulture. However, due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
